Work

My work

I’ve been lucky to work on a wide range of cool projects. In a given day, I might sketch, wireframe, prototype, facilitate a workshop, or manage a backlog of features.

Read some case studies below and reach out to me justin@jbarr.co if you find anything interesting.

Nissan Living Lab

User research, product validation, and prototyping

Nissan Motor Company hired Carbon Five to test an early-stage product concept based on shared car ownership. Along with Nissan’s innovation group, we conducted a research experiment with real families sharing vehicles for month. I designed digital and physical tools to aid the experiment and built an app prototype based on our learnings.

Read more

Farmers Insurance App Rebuild

Visual design, project management, and Agile methodology

Farmers Insurance hired Carbon Five to rebuild its Android and iOS apps, and to use the opportunity to train their new in-house team in Agile development. I led the design team in tackling significant design debt and creating a brand new style guide.

Read more

WordPress Hosting

UX research, information architecture, and UI design

When Media Temple revamped its WordPress hosting platform, I had the opportunity to significantly improve the product’s user experience. I designed a friendly on-boarding process, reorganized the navigation and features in the control panel, and planned the product’s information architecture to accommodate future features.

Read more

Google Apps Hosting Package

UX research, information architecture, and UI design

Media Temple launched a new hosting package integrating Google Apps for Work. It’s a one-stop shop for setting up a web presence, including a website and Google Apps using a custom domain name. I designed an on-boarding experience and control panel UI intended to make the entire process simple and easy.

Read more

Info

Justin Barr Young is a product expert pushing pixels and code in sunny Los Angeles. For over a decade, he’s been working, learning, and mentoring in the sweet spot where design thinking, technology, and business meet. When he’s away from the computer, he’s riding his bike, reading nonfiction, or sampling local beers.

He built this site using LESS, Jekyll, CodeKit, and parts of Novastrap by @itsmeara.
